intro: Scleranthus tabernaemontani, commonly known as the common thornweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants known for their distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences. S. tabernaemontani is known for its ability to thrive in harsh environments, making it a resilient and adaptive species.
